result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nolan J. Whitegull

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person with Attorney Poss.  Defendant plead no contest as follows:  16CM189, 2 Counts of BJ.  16CM191 -1 count BJ.  16cm192.  2 Counts of BJ.  15CM284, 16CM78,16CM137, 16CM207 all dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 8, 2016 at 11:15 am.
Defendant appears with counsel SPD William Poss.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Will be set on plea/sent calendar.  SPD Poss will schedule with J.A. on all cases.
Status conference on November 21, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Poss appeared in court.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant did not appear.  Attorney Poss appeared in court.  Warrant authorized.
Status conference on October 31, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Not settled yet.  Plea/sentencing to be rescheduled.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Poss.  Defendant in Jackson Co. jail.  Set for a plea.
Status conference on September 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Attorney Poss appeared.  Defendant did not appear for the STC today.  Warrant authorized.
Plea & sentencing hearing cancelled at the email request of Atty Poss. DA Fox and Atty Poss are doing a TAD referral to the HoChunk Nation on this case.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-04-2016 01:30 pm
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Poss.  Have case resolved.  Defendant in 45 day treatment facility.  Set plea/sentencing.

Pre-trial conference at 01-06-2016 10:00 am.
Status conference at 01-25-2016 03:00 pm.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Waive reading of the complaint.  Defendant stood mute.  NGP entered by court.  PTC 1/6 and STC 1/25.  Bond continued.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.
